sentences.text: Bindwood now can preserve all your bookmarks, folders, and feeds, but we need to tidy up the records in the database before we can proceed.
Please don't be alarmed if you notice a lag while Bindwood is migrating your bookmarks.
I don't believe I had ever installed bindwood before, so I'm not sure what it's migrating.
I had bindwood installed in karmic but removed it as it worked horible back then.
Thank you for helping with making Ubuntu and Bindwood better by reporting this bug.
I can confirm this issue myself on an up-to-date version of Ubuntu Lucid.
I'm setting the status to Triaged and opening an upstream task so the developers can take a look at this issue.
The only time you *should* be getting the migration status is if you've got some records in your local desktop couch and some preferences set in Firefox (triggered from an earlier Bindwood run).

Can you please enable a boolean Firefox pref called bindwood.debug and set it to True, when running in debug mode, the Javascript console will output a lot of info, and there's likely one little crash point.
If you can include that as an attachment here, it might help diagnose.
Setting bindwood.debug=true, after sync runs for a bit, I get the following.

Bindwood: Couldn't find a UUID for itemId: 2824 message: 'Component returned failure code: 0x80040111 (NS_ERROR_NOT_AVAILABLE) [nsIAnnotationService.getItemAnnotation]', reason: 'undefined', description: 'undefined', error: 'undefined', raw error: '{}'
Bindwood: UUID We came up with: {eaeb55c4-f3c2-4c98-a77d-de642bc0fb9d}
The couch source for those IDs is:
ok, i added a new boolean

Bindwood: Annotation on 380: {b5142add-3171-46e5-a983-c9b851f43481}
Bindwood: XXX: Still haven't found the right itemId!
Bindwood: Found its local itemID from the map: undefined

Bindwood: UUID We came up with: {0398a489-1d6e-4afa-8f11-6626c4effbd4}
Bindwood: Annotating the item now.
This bug was fixed in the package bindwood - 1.0.4-0ubuntu1
In addition to removing the pop-up, it also should fix the error that was causing the migration to seem to go on forever.
Please try it out and see if this issue is resolved.
Re: [Bug 560583] Re: Bindwood migrates for infinity

Updated to 1.0.4 and no longer get the dialog/popup but the same errors are in the error console.

Bindwood: Couldn't find a UUID for itemId: 2824 message: 'Component returned failure code: 0x80040111 (NS_ERROR_NOT_AVAILABLE) [nsIAnnotationService.getItemAnnotation]', reason: 'undefined', description: 'undefined', error: 'undefined', raw error: '{}'

On Fri, Apr 16, 2010 at 9:02 AM, Matthew Gregg <email address hidden> wrote:

> Updated to 1.0.4 and no longer get the dialog/popup but the same errors
> are in the error console.
Can you try running this attached script and paste the resulting output?

If you've gone through a successful migration, you'd see something like the
following:
I don't get any output from the script.
However it gave me an idea, so I vacuumed Firefox's sqlite db's.
Next start of firefox and Bindwood looks to have sync'd correctly or at least made it a lot farther.
I restarted FF after it seem to have completed and now get a few of these:
Bindwood: XXX: Still haven't found the right itemId!
Bindwood: Found its local itemID from the map: undefined
Bindwood: UUID We came up with: 0210882007b5e6240b4f506033a494b7
Bindwood: Something wrong with the process, exiting.

message: 'Component returned failure code: 0x80070057 (NS_ERROR_ILLEGAL_VALUE) [nsIAnnotationService.setItemAnnotation]', reason: 'undefined', description: 'undefined', error: 'undefined', raw error: '{}'
The script still doesn't produce any output.
